TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BuildParameters extends System.Object

Docs.summary: This class represents all of the settings which must be specified to start a build.
Creates build parameters.

Docs.remarks: This differs from the BuildProcessEnvironment in that there are certain MSBuild-specific properties which are added, and those environment variables which would not be valid as MSBuild properties are removed.

[<set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")>]

Docs.summary: Enables or disables legacy threading semantics
Docs.value: Returns a switch that enables or disables legacy threading semantics; true if enabled, false otherwise.
Docs.remarks: Legacy threading semantics indicate that if a submission is to be built only on the in-proc node and the submission is executed synchronously, then all of its requests will be built on the thread which invoked the build rather than a thread owned by the BuildManager.

Attribute.AttributeName: [get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")]
[<get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")>]
[set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")]
[<set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")>]

Docs.summary: Flag indicating if the operating environment such as the current directory and environment be saved and restored between project builds and task invocations. This should be set to false for any other build managers running in the system so that we do not have two build managers trampling on each others environment.
Docs.value: Returns a switch indicating whether the operating environment should be saved and restored between project builds and task invocations; true if the environment should be saved, false otherwise.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This should be set to false for any other build managers running in the system so that we do not have two build managers trampling on each others environment.

member this.ShutdownInProcNodeOnBuildFinish : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Shutdown the inprocess node when the build finishes. By default this is false since visual studio needs to keep the inprocess node around after the build finishes.

Docs.summary: By default if the number of processes is set to 1 we will use Asynchronous logging. However if we want to use synchronous logging when the number of cpu's is set to 1 this property needs to be set to true.
Docs.value: Returns a switch that specifies whether synchronous logging is used when there is only a single process; if true, use synchronous logging, otherwise use asynchronous logging.
